title: Ronald Mather
text:
Ronald "Ronnie" Mather (first ¼ 1927 – 2 October 2011) was an English professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1950s, and <a href="Coach%20%28sports%29">coach</a>ed. He played at representative level for <a href="Rugby%20League%20War%20of%20the%20Roses">Lancashire</a>, and at club level for <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan</a>, as a , i.e. number 9, during the era of contested <a href="Scrum%20%28rugby%29%23Rugby%20league">scrum</a>s, and coached at club level for <a href="Warrington%20Wolves">Warrington</a> (<a href="Reserve%20team">A-Team</a>), and <a href="Scout%20%28sport%29">scout</a>ed for <a href="Warrington%20Wolves">Warrington</a>.
Background.
Ronnie Mather's birth was registered in <a href="Wigan">Wigan</a> district, <a href="Lancashire">Lancashire</a>, England, he worked as a <a href="machinist">machinist</a> at the <a href="National%20Coal%20Board">National Coal Board</a>, and later as a mechanical instructor at the NCB Old Boston training centre at Haydock, Lancashire. He died aged 84 in <a href="Wigan">Wigan</a> district, <a href="Greater%20Manchester">Greater Manchester</a>, England.
Playing career.
Championship Final appearances.
Ronnie Mather played in <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan</a>'s 13–6 victory over <a href="Bradford%20Bulls">Bradford Northern</a> in the <a href="Rugby%20Football%20League%20Championship">Championship</a> Final during the <a href="1951%E2%80%9352%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1951–52 season</a> at <a href="Leeds%20Road">Leeds Road</a>, <a href="Huddersfield">Huddersfield</a> on Saturday 10 May 1952.
County League appearances.
Ronnie Mather played in <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan</a>'s victory in the <a href="RFL%20Lancashire%20League">Lancashire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20leagues">County League</a> during the <a href="1951%E2%80%9352%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1951–52 season</a> .
County Cup Final appearances.
Ronnie Mather played in <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan</a>'s 28–5 victory over <a href="Warrington%20Wolves">Warrington</a> in the <a href="1950%E2%80%9351%20Lancashire%20Cup">1950–51</a> <a href="RFL%20Lancashire%20Cup">Lancashire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1950%E2%80%9351%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1950–51 season</a> at <a href="Station%20Road%2C%20Swinton">Station Road, Swinton</a>, on Saturday 4 November 1950, played in the 14–6 victory over <a href="Leigh%20Centurions">Leigh</a> in the <a href="1951%E2%80%9352%20Lancashire%20Cup">1951–52</a> <a href="RFL%20Lancashire%20Cup">Lancashire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1951%E2%80%9352%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1951–52 season</a> at <a href="Station%20Road%2C%20Swinton">Station Road, Swinton</a>, on Saturday 27 October 1951, and played in the 8–16 defeat by <a href="St%20Helens%20R.F.C.">St. Helens</a> in the <a href="1953%E2%80%9354%20Lancashire%20Cup">1953–54</a> <a href="RFL%20Lancashire%20Cup">Lancashire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1953%E2%80%9354%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1953–54 season</a> at <a href="Station%20Road%2C%20Swinton">Station Road, Swinton</a> on Saturday 24 October 1953.
Club career.
Ronnie Mather made his début for Wigan against <a href="Dewsbury%20Rams">Dewsbury</a> at <a href="Crown%20Flatt">Crown Flatt</a> on Saturday 19 August 1950, and played his last game for Wigan against <a href="Whitehaven%20R.L.F.C.">Whitehaven</a> at <a href="Recreation%20Ground%20%28Whitehaven%29">Recreation Ground</a> on Saturday 21 September 1957.
Genealogical information.
Ronnie Mather's marriage to Elsie (<a href="Given%20name%23Name%20at%20birth">née</a> Smales) was registered during third ¼ 1949 in <a href="Wigan">Wigan</a> district. They had children; Stephen P. Mather (birth registered during third ¼ in <a href="Wigan">Wigan</a> district).
